title: Can't send an email list to more than 5 people and it's not the server or my security apps.
content: In the last few weeks I can't send an email list using Thunderbird on my PC or Apple mail on my IPAD to more than 5 people and it's not the client server or my security apps. For Thunderbird I get a "1550 error", even for a small list of 8 people. The 6th plus rest of the addresses always come up as not valid even though I can send a singular message message to each of the addresses. For OS I get " X...is not a valid email address and has been rejected by the server." 1) I've talked to server support and when I use their web email (a pain), everything goes through. I have enough space on the server. I'm supposed to be able to send a list with 99 people on it. They say this test proves it is Thunderbird's problem but I wonder why it is happening on OS with Apple mail, too. 2) I talked to my security company McAfee and when we deleted the app I still had the problem. 3) I deleted Thunderbird from my PC and added it back again and still had the problem. 4)The server company suggested that I talk to Thunderbird about the PC and for OS delete the Apple mail app completely , not just remove the bothersome account and then try with a new app. This seems scary to me, as I will lose years worth of collected address and contacts. Thanks if you can help.
creator: indigo2310

title: Yahoo.com email redirecting to Rogers Member Center

The account itself has nothing to do with Rogers. Never has. It was created directly with Yahoo long before Rogers teamed up with them.

Is this a glitch in Thunderbird, or is it something with Yahoo's servers?

Thank you, Glen

title: Message filtering using the "Body" filter appears to ignore the HTML part of an email(?)
content:
I have been trying to filter out and delete emails with certain URLs in the HTML section of the body of the message.

I can get the Body filter to activate and delete the email if I send the specified URL within a simple text message. So the Body filter can activate on sequences in the text part of a multimode or simple text email.

It doesn't, however, seem to activate for the thing I truly need, which is to see a URL (or other sequence) in the HTML part of a multimode. It appears to ignore the HTML section.

Would it be possible to either:

1) allow the current Body filter to scan all parts of a multimode message? OR

2) create a new filter, perhaps named Rawbody, or Raw, etc., which doesn't break down and separate the parts of a multimode first, but simply does a raw scan of the entire body: text, HTML, and all?

Thank you.

title: Thunderbird login with password compromised.......
content: I have 3 devices: 1. Desktop PC/Windows 10 with Thunderbird (TB) installed many years. 2. Laptop with TB installed many years. 3. Identical laptop with no TB and only a few apps that I use with external HDD for music tuition. Thursday early morning 11 Sept 2025 desktop working all ok, no laptops on. Thursday midday I receive the TB message "Enter your password for.... (my email address) on pop3....(my email ISP). I proceed as instructed but message "Login to server pop3......with username.........failed. Retry / Enter New Password / Cancel". I was using a VPN at the time, disconnected and tried again, same problem. Nearly 2 hours with the ISP techies since then, still no solution. Now it becomes interesting. With Desktop PC and laptop1 both shutdown, a clean TB installation onto laptop2 produced identical results. Techie reckons that an app somewhere is stopping the successful login from all devices. I have very different apps on all 3 devices. How can an app on my desktop PC (shutdown) for example effect TB on a new installation on laptop2? Techie also said that a full uninstall on desktop PC and laptop1 will not solve it. All updates are regularly done.It sounds like quantum entanglement has arrived here! Any thoughts.....?

title: Thunderbird startup error when using flatpak version on Debian 13
content:
Hi all:

I was running thunderbird (v128.14.0esr) installed from Debian 12 (bookworm) repositories with no problems. My profile folder is on a network drive, I know this is NOT recommended but I am the only user and this configuration has worked flawlessly for several years. Recently I upgrade to Debian 13 (Trixie) and installed the flatpak version of thunderbird (v140.3.0esr) to get the more current version than in Debian 13 repos.

My problem is when starting the flatpak version, I get error "Thunderbird is already running but not responding". The "ps -ax" command does NOT show any process with thunderbird in the name and I cannot figure out what is wrong.

Here are the contents of my flatseal configuration/overrides file: [Context] sockets=inherit-wayland-socket;session-bus filesystems=/mnt/fserver/Applications/Mozilla/TBird/Profiles/Default;home;host-etc;host-os;host

[Environment] MOZ_NO_REMOTE=1

My profile is located at /mnt/fserver/Applications/Mozilla/TBird/Profiles/Default and I can access it from my Debian system.


Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.
creator: khw1502

title: Marking some emails as "junk" only makes them disappear for a moment
content:
Lately, it seems some junk mail senders have figured out how to keep me from deleting an email from my inbox, even though they've been marked as junk. They only disappear from the inbox for a few seconds, and then re-appear immediately. I can click "delete" over and over, and yet these emails boomerang right back into my inbox. Filters don't seem to work for these senders, either. I can open the filter, see that the email address is already included, click "Run Now," and all I get is a pop-up Microsoft notification that is truncated so that I can't read it in its entirety.

The main offender lately is Heavy on Packers <newsletters@heavy.com>

Why doesn't the filter or even the delete key get rid of messages from this spammer and a few others like it? How does something marked as Junk and deleted keep boomeranging back into the inbox? TIA!
creator: RoseQueen

title: Thunderbird 142.0 (Windows 64bit) - Item changed on server issue with calendar notifications
content:
Hey all,

For about half of the notifications I get from my google calendar, I get a dialogue warning me that the item has changed on the server and I can submit my changes anyway or discard and reload. It doesn't matter what I choose - the pop up goes away and reappears at the next notification.

I have searched for other reports of this issue and seen it reported many times in the last few years. I have tried all of the known solutions but none of them seem to fix the issue for me.

Here's what I've tried:

- Unsubscribed and resubscribed to the google calendar - Unsubscribed, shut down Thunderbird, deleted the calendar-data folder from my profile, opened Thunderbird, and resubscribed to the google calendar - Toggled "Read Only" every which way - Toggled "Offline Support" every which way - Turned off show reminders (which fixes it of course but I want reminders, that's the problem) - Deleted the offending events in my google calendar and recreated them from scratch - which has returned the same "item changed on server" warning.

I don't know what else to do at this point. I don't see any new reports of this issue so am I just missing something fundamental here? Do people not use google calendar in Thunderbird? Is it known to not work if you have an iPhone that also shows calendar notifications or something?

My desktop specs are Windows 11, everything at latest, no additional calendars other than "Holidays in the United States" (which I think comes with Thunderbird), and the BorderColors D extension to change colors of my email border depending on which address I'm sending from.
creator: alwaysusa
